citation.article-title: Nocardioides ultimimeridianus sp. nov. and Nocardioides maradonensis sp. nov., isolated from rhizosphere soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardioides ultimimeridianus sp. nov.

Nocardioides ultimimeridianus (ul.ti.mi.me.ri.di.a′nus. L. superl. adj. ultimus farthest, extreme; L. adj. meridianus of or belonging to the south, southern, meridional; N.L. masc. adj. ultimimeridianus of the farthest south, referring to the region in the Republic of Korea where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-reaction-positive, oxidase-negative, catalase-positive, non-motile short rods (0.6–1.0×1.0–1.6 µm).
Colonies are moderately yellow in colour, circular, convex with entire margins and reach 0.2–0.3 mm in diameter after incubation for 5 days (on ISP 2 medium at 30 °C).
Growth does not occur on TSA or NA.
Growth occurs at 10–42 °C (optimum 30–37 °C), at pH 5.0–10.1 and in 1 % (w/v) NaCl.
Hydrolyses casein, but not cellulose or DNA.
Does not degrade hypoxanthine, dl-tyrosine or xanthine.
Positive for esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, α-glucosidase and trypsin (weak response).
Utilizes cellobiose, citrate, dextran, d-fructose, gluconate (weakly), d-glucose, dl-malate, raffinose, d-sorbitol, succinate, sucrose and dl-tartrate as sole carbon and energy sources.
Does not utilize adonitol, d-arabinose, benzoate, dulcitol, meso-erythritol, formate, glycerol, lactose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, l-sorbose, trehalose, d-xylitol or d-xylose.
Data for other physiological and biochemical properties are given in Table 1.
ll-DAP is the diagnostic diamino acid.
The polar lipids include phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylglycerol.
The major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω9c, C16 : 0 and C16 : 0 2-OH.
The type strain, RP-B26T ( = KCTC 19368T = DSM 19768T), was isolated from rhizosphere soil of a cliff-associated plant (Peucedanum japonicum Thunb.) on Mara Island, Jeju, Republic of Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 73.0 mol%.
